org.si.diamond.base.mail.session

Class MailSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.si.diamond.base.mail.session.MailSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMailSession

    public class MailSession
extends Object
implements IMailSession
    This class will hold the most common configuration and transport mechanism for sending emails. email messages will be built outside of this class but will then be passed into this class to be sent. Those who wish to make use of this class needs to provide the compulsory configuration for JavaMail. This class will initialize all of the most common configuration and create the main session. It is recommended that one MailSessionObject will be the default mechanism to send an email over one particular SMTP,
    if it is required to send via another SMTP Host which is not defined in this class,
    then it is recomended to create another instance of this class MailSession mailSession = new MailSession("Session Unique Name", "host.smtp.com", null); mailSession.connect("adelwin", "MailPassword0"); -- create COTSMailMessage here as mailMessage mailSession.send(mailMessage); This class is designed to be collected to a HashMap to make it faster and easier to send batch emails over multiple transport. Map mailSessionMap = new HashMap(); MailSession mailSessionEOD = new MailSession("Session Unique Name 01"); mailSessionMap.put(mailSessionEOD.getIdentifier(), mailSessionEOD); MailSession mailSessionIOD = new MailSession("Session Unique Name 02"); mailSessionMap.put(mailSessionIOD.getIdentifier(), mailSessionIOD); This means later on when the caller wishes to retrieve some mailSession object, they can just retrieve from a Map. n order to reduce overhead on creating new session and transport object all over again, it is advised to use an easy to relate identifier, like an SMTP Name, or maybe SubModule as an identifier.
    Author:
    ahandoyo

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect()
      Method Name : connect(void) this method will provide basic connect mechanism, the initialization of this class is recommended to call this method if the implementor provides smtpUser and Password while creating this class, that detail will be used to connect, if not, then a normal non parameterized connect method of the transport object will be used this connect method should only be needed to called only and if only, a Non-Static Transport type is being used
